title: GRIEVE is Professor of Spanish and Chair of the Department of Spanish and Portuguese at Columbia University. She holds a Ph.D. in Romance Languages and Literatures from Princeton University, and specializes in Comparative Medieval Studies and Spanish Golden Age Literature. She has published two books, Desire and Death in Spanish Sentimental Romances

title: BURT KIMMELMAN is an Associate Professor of English and Humanities at New Jersey Institute of Technology. He has published articles on later medieval poetry and philosophy, and a book, The Poetics of Authorship in the Later Middle Ages: The Emergence of the Modern Literary Persona
